page.title: 09Leisure in the 1980's
page.content: A school questionaire revealed the following: Many people have leisure technology in their homes, such as 2 televisions, record players, tape recorders and hi-fi's. Videos don't seem to be catching on though it is a recent invention.Clubs and hobbies are also popular. There are a lot of local football clubs and many boys belong to them. Many girls belong to ballet classes. School leisure consists of clubs:tennis, pottery, football and more. Swimming & rounders are some of the 'fun' activities of school. A family holiday to America might cost Â£3000 for four. Stamp collecting, piano, football & ballet come high up the list of hobbies. Overall, people spend about one-third of their lives in leisure activities. But the question is: Will the fraction be larger or smaller in 100 years time?
